DRAS Deferral of a Decision in a Pregnant IDES Participant's Case
DRASs may defer a decision on any issue in a pregnant IDES participant’s case if the evidence of record is insufficient to decide that issue because the participant was unable to undergo some or all examinations due to pregnancy.
If a DRAS defers a decision on one or more issues in a
final
rating decision, it must process the deferral according to the instructions in
M21-1, Part X, Subpart i, 6.J.1.e
.
Exception
:  If a DRAS is unable to prepare a final rating decision because it must defer a decision on
all
issues in a pregnant participant’s case, the DRAS must establish EP 930 (instead of a rating EP), with a suspense date that is 90 days after the participant’s anticipated delivery date.
